intro: Lyciodes parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved lyciodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
